definitions.definition: a long, narrow mark or band.
examples: a row of closely spaced dots will look like a continuous line
synonyms: striation "he drew a line through the name"

definitions.definition: a straight or curved continuous extent of length without breadth.
a positioning or movement of a thing or things that creates or appears to follow a line.
examples: her mouth set in an angry line

definitions.definition: a furrow or wrinkle in the skin of the face or hands.
examples: wrinkle, furrow, crease, groove, crinkle, crow's foot, laugh line there were lines around her eyes

definitions.definition: a contour or outline considered as a feature of design or composition.
examples: crisp architectural lines
synonyms: profile "the classic lines of the exterior"

definitions.definition: (on a map or graph) a curve connecting all points having a specified common property.
a line marking the starting or finishing point in a race.
a line marked on a field or court that relates to the rules of a game or sport.
the line of scrimmage.
the equator.
examples: noun: Line; noun: the Line

definitions.definition: a notional limit or boundary.
examples: the issue of peace cut across class lines
synonyms: frontier "the line between Canada and the United States"

definitions.definition: each of the very narrow horizontal sections forming a television picture.
a narrow range of the spectrum noticeably brighter or darker than the adjacent parts.
the level of the base of most letters, such as h and x, in printing and writing.
examples: noun: the line

definitions.definition: denoting an illustration or graphic consisting of lines and solid areas, with no gradation of tone.
examples: modifier noun: line

definitions.definition: each of (usually five) horizontal lines forming a staff in musical notation.
a sequence of notes or tones forming an instrumental or vocal melody.
examples: a powerful melodic line

definitions.definition: a dose of a powdered narcotic or hallucinatory drug, especially cocaine or heroin, laid out in a line.
a length of cord, rope, wire, or other material serving a particular purpose.
examples: wring the clothes and hang them on the line
synonyms: strand "he put the wash on the line"

definitions.definition: a telephone connection.
examples: she had a crank on the line

definitions.definition: a railroad track.
a branch or route of a railroad system.
examples: the Philadelphia to Baltimore line

definitions.definition: a company that provides ships, aircraft, or buses on particular routes on a regular basis.
examples: a major shipping line

definitions.definition: a horizontal row of written or printed words.
a part of a poem forming one row of written or printed words.
examples: each stanza has eight lines
synonyms: citation "the opening line of the poem"

definitions.definition: the words of an actor's part in a play or film.
examples: words, part, script, speech he couldn't remember his lines

definitions.definition: an amount of text or number of repetitions of a sentence written out as a school punishment.
a row of people or things.
examples: a line of acolytes proceeded down the aisle

definitions.definition: a row or sequence of people or vehicles awaiting their turn to be attended to or to proceed.
a connected series of people following one another in time (used especially of several generations of a family).
examples: we follow the history of a family through the male line

definitions.definition: (in football, hockey, etc.) a set of players in the forwardmost positions for offense or defense.
one of the positions on the line of scrimmage.
a series of related things.
examples: the bill is the latest in a long line of measures to protect society from criminals
synonyms: cycle "a long line of bad decisions"

definitions.definition: a range of commercial goods.
examples: the company intends to hire more people and expand its product line

definitions.definition: a false or exaggerated account or story.
examples: he feeds me a line about this operation
synonyms: fabrication; informalspiel "he fed me a line"

definitions.definition: the point spread for sports events on which bets may be made.
an area or branch of activity.
examples: the stresses unique to their line of work
synonyms: area of expertise "my line is engineering"

definitions.definition: a direction, course, or channel.
examples: lines of communication
synonyms: philosophy "they took a very tough line with the industry"

definitions.definition: a manner of doing or thinking about something.
examples: you can't run a business on these lines
synonyms: philosophy "they took a very tough line with the industry"course

definitions.definition: an agreed-upon approach; a policy.
examples: the official line is that there were no chemical attacks on allied troops

definitions.definition: a connected series of military fieldworks or defenses facing an enemy force.
examples: raids behind enemy lines

definitions.definition: an arrangement of soldiers or ships in a column or line formation; a line of battle.
examples: row, file, lineup, queue they waited in a line

definitions.definition: regular army regiments (as opposed to auxiliary forces or household troops).
examples: noun: the line

definitions.definition: stand or be positioned at intervals along.
examples: a processional route lined by people waving flags
synonyms: rim "the driveway was lined by poplars"

definitions.definition: mark or cover with lines.
examples: a thin woman with a lined face
synonyms: mark with lines "her face was lined with age"

definitions.definition: hit a line drive.
